articles.title: BJP Appoints Bihar Minister Nitin Nabin as Working President
articles.summary: Bihar minister Nitin Nabin was appointed BJP's national working president, replacing JP Nadda, marking a leadership shift in the party. The announcement came amid preparations for NDA MLAs' meeting in Bihar to elect their leader. This development signals generational change within BJP.[2]

articles.title: Indian Rupee Falls to Record Low of 90.56 Against US Dollar
articles.summary: The Indian rupee depreciated to a historic low of 90.56 per US dollar on December 15, continuing its second straight week of decline. This weakening impacts imports and investor sentiment amid global economic pressures. Traders anticipate further volatility.[3]

articles.title: Delhi-NCR AQI Hits 481, Offices Ordered 50% Staff Attendance
articles.summary: Delhi's air quality deteriorated to AQI 481, turning the city into a gas chamber, with Noida at 557 and Greater Noida at 422 on December 15. Authorities mandated 50% staff attendance in offices and hybrid school modes due to severe pollution. This marks the second dirtiest December day on record.[3][2][4]

articles.title: Union Cabinet Approves Insurance Laws Amendment Bill 2025
articles.summary: The Union Cabinet approved the Sabka Bima Sabki Raksha Bill on December 15, amending three insurance laws for modernisation, wider coverage, and stronger regulation. The bill paves the way for introduction in Parliament to enhance sector oversight. It aims to boost insurance penetration across India.[5]

articles.title: Government Launches National Cyber Safety Awareness Campaign
articles.summary: The Government of India initiated a National Cyber Safety Awareness Drive for students on December 15, focusing on digital safety, responsible online behavior, and data protection. The campaign targets schools and colleges nationwide to combat rising cyber threats. It promotes secure internet usage among youth.[1]

articles.title: India Wins Squash World Cup Defeating Hong Kong 3-0
articles.summary: India's squash team secured a historic victory by defeating top-seeded Hong Kong 3-0 in the Squash World Cup final held in Chennai on December 15. This marks the national team's first title in the tournament. The win boosts India's presence in international squash.[1]

articles.title: Airports Authority Issues Fog Advisory for Northern India Flights
articles.summary: The Airports Authority of India warned of flight disruptions on December 15 due to dense fog across northern India. Passengers were urged to check flight status in advance amid low visibility conditions. Multiple airports reported delays and diversions.[7]

articles.title: Congress Holds Rally in Delhi Over Vote Theft Allegations
articles.summary: Congress organized a rally in the national capital on December 15, reiterating claims of 'vote chori' against the Election Commission. Rahul Gandhi vowed to remove the Modi government and criticized electoral processes. The event drew significant party support.[2]

articles.title: GIFT City Announces 2.5-Acre Public Sports Arena Project
articles.summary: GIFT City in Gujarat announced plans for a 2.5-acre public sports arena on December 15, featuring football, cricket, basketball, and more facilities. This urban expansion aims to promote fitness and community engagement. Construction will support the city's growth as a smart hub.[1]

articles.title: ISRO Reschedules BlueBird-6 Indo-US Satellite Launch to Dec 21
articles.summary: ISRO postponed the launch of the BlueBird-6 broadband satellite, the heaviest US commercial payload from India, to December 21, 2025. The mission seeks to enhance global internet access through advanced satellite technology. The delay ensures mission readiness.[1]
